atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the @tailwind directive to insert Tailwind's base, components, utilities and variants styles into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use the @apply directive to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: Use the @layer directive to tell Tailwind which layer a set of custom styles belong to.

atDirectives.name: @config
atDirectives.description: Use the @config directive to specify which config file Tailwind should use when compiling a CSS file.

atDirectives.name: @responsive
atDirectives.description: The @responsive directive lets you control which responsive breakpoints a utility should be generated for.

atDirectives.name: @screen
atDirectives.description: The @screen directive lets you create media queries that reference your breakpoints by name.

atDirectives.name: @variants
atDirectives.description: The @variants directive lets you control which variants each utility should be generated for.
